title: Stemplot
question_text:
An economist studied the annual returns of $24$ randomly selected stocks over a given year. The stem-and-leaf plot below shows the returns (in percents) on these stocks over the year.
Stem-and-leaf display: returns
*Stem-and-leaf of returns: N = $24$
*Leaf unit = $1.0$
Key: $1 | 3 = 13\%$
$-1| 2$
$-0|$
$-0| 4$
$0 |34$
$0 |677$
$1 |013344$
$1 |5566$
$2 |011$
$2 |79$
$3 |0$
$3 |7$
The mean return of these $24$ stocks is closest to:

choices.text: Unable to determine based off the graph.
